title: How to Howl at the Moon
author: Eli Easton

vocabularies.definition: 〔感情などが〕湧き起こること、動揺
vocabularies.example: Add in jeans, a jean jacket, and T-shirt, all of which had seen better decades, and Lance felt a touch of unease stirring in his belly.
She’d understand if she’d seen the guy. Suspicious, yes, but in retrospect also weirdly cute. Probably way cuter than baby Samantha.
Right there. That little… Ah. Lance gave a whimper as Tim’s lovely scrubbing fingers moved over an itchy place.
God, you could see the man’s distinctly sculpted quad muscles as he walked, not to mention a considerable package. That ought to be illegal. Seriously.
God, you could see the man’s distinctly sculpted quad muscles as he walked, not to mention a considerable package. That ought to be illegal. Seriously.
Excuse me, officer. I want to make a citizen’s arrest for indecent exposure and inciting a riot.
Excuse me, officer. I want to make a citizen’s arrest for indecent exposure and inciting a riot.
The song Tim chose for his moonlight run was We Will Rock You. Lance decided to jog along so he could hear the full rendition clearly.

vocabularies.definition: 《be ～》〈俗〉アンフェタミンを使用中である
vocabularies.example: Lance dashed back and forth around Tim like he was on speed. It was his dog’s way of laughing.
The kiss stripped away the remaining tatters of his doubts and defenses, and Lance knew with certainly, by the swelling of his heart, that he had bonded with Tim completely.
I know we just talked about me being, well, wary of violence? But I want you to know there’s another part of me that really wants you to push me up against a wall someday, Officer.
Out there in the night, naked on a mountain top, with Lance’s beautiful and very male human form, but the beast still prowling just below the skin.
There was something dangerous and primal about the animal nature -- completely unself-conscious, focused, unashamed, and lost in its mate, driven by pure instinct.
There was something dangerous and primal about the animal nature -- completely unself-conscious, focused, unashamed, and lost in its mate, driven by pure instinct.

vocabularies.definition: 言葉に詰まりながら言う
vocabularies.example: “Die by the s-s-sword?” Elliot was stuttering in his rage. “Are you fucking kidding me?” “Not literally, obviously! I just mean—”
Elliot had an overwhelming desire—need—to be overpowered in bed. He liked to be fucked—quite literally—into submission.
Elliot had an overwhelming desire—need—to be overpowered in bed. He liked to be fucked—quite literally—into submission.

vocabularies.definition: 〔人が仕事などにおいて〕有能な、能力がある
vocabularies.example: In his youth he had struggled with this self-knowledge, resisted it, but as he’d grown up and gained experience he’d eventually accepted the truth that, as important as it was to him to be confident, competent and in control of all other aspects of his life, in bed he was a complete and abject bottom.

vocabularies.definition: 絶望的な、悲惨な、惨めな
vocabularies.example: In his youth he had struggled with this self-knowledge, resisted it, but as he’d grown up and gained experience he’d eventually accepted the truth that, as important as it was to him to be confident, competent and in control of all other aspects of his life, in bed he was a complete and abject bottom.
“Say it,” Tucker ordered softly. Soft but stern. And that made it easy because Tucker was in charge here.
“Say it,” Tucker ordered softly. Soft but stern. And that made it easy because Tucker was in charge here.
Hell, he was less than an inch away from castrating him. Elliot had to obey.
Tucker’s arms clamped so tight, Elliot wondered if his ribs would crack.
They had their battles, but he couldn’t remember ever feeling more comfortable or content in his adult life than he had these past months with Tucker.

vocabularies.definition: 〔火をおこすための〕たき付け
vocabularies.example: When I woke several hours later, Jake was outside reducing the timberline to a pile of kindling.
For a time I stood at the window admiring the bronzed musculature of his bare chest as he sweated and chopped wood with manly ferocity.

vocabularies.definition: 凶暴性、残忍な行為、どう猛性
vocabularies.example: For a time I stood at the window admiring the bronzed musculature of his bare chest as he sweated and chopped wood with manly ferocity.

vocabularies.definition: 相づちを打つ、同意する
vocabularies.example: “Kevin was just leaving,” I said, managing to detach myself from Kevin. “Did he mistake you for the door?” “It’s not what you think,” Kevin chimed in. Not really a helpful remark.

vocabularies.definition: 寸分の違いもなく、的確に
vocabularies.example: I caught my breath as his finger moved knowledgeably, unerringly. “There’s the off button,” he murmured.

vocabularies.definition: 寸分の違いもなく、的確に
vocabularies.example: I caught my breath as his finger moved knowledgeably, unerringly. “There’s the off button,” he murmured.

vocabularies.definition: 〔肉体的な〕骨折り、奮闘、大変な努力
vocabularies.example: “I owe you one, baby,” he muttered against my ear. I could feel his heart banging away with exertion and excitement against my own. It was the most beautiful sound in the world, and I closed my eyes as I listened and thought, I love you.

“Yeah. Monday when you pretended to be looking for prowlers in my closet.” He laughed. “Hey, it’s not much of a closet is it?” “No. It’s not. I don’t like closets. Life’s too short to spend hiding in the dark.”

vocabularies.definition: 〔動物からはいだ毛の付いた〕生皮
vocabularies.example: Then I got another mental image of him, broad chest covered in blond pelt, muscular forearms, big smooth cock jutting out of a silky nest.
Listened to pinpricks of rain against the windows. The wettest winter since El Niño, everyone kept saying.
Riordan was not remotely my type. Even without the whips and canes and butt plugs.

vocabularies.definition: それなのに、それにもかかわらず
vocabularies.example: And yet. And yet there was something about his strength, his arrogance, his sheer size that got under my skin.
And yet. And yet there was something about his strength, his arrogance, his sheer size that got under my skin.
He probably couldn’t even spell vanilla. He was probably selfish in the sack. Probably selfish and greedy and … unsophisticated.

vocabularies.definition: 〔人などが〕素朴な、世慣れていない
vocabularies.example: He probably couldn’t even spell vanilla. He was probably selfish in the sack. Probably selfish and greedy and … unsophisticated.

vocabularies.definition: 不器用に扱う、下手にいじり回す
vocabularies.example: He shrugged out of his suede jacket, tossed it to me. It felt like something newly dead hanging there in my hands. After a moment I fumbled my way into it. It was warm from his body and carried the scent of his soap.
There was silence. I listened. He didn’t say anything. “Are we communicating through the Psychic Hotline or what?” “Shut up a sec,” he said from between his pearly whites.

His glance slid my way. “You know, this won’t be an easy thing, Adrien.” An officer-involved shooting was not going to be fun, righteous or not. “The investigation you mean?” “No.” He gave me that crooked smile. “No, I don’t mean that.” I stared out at the first blush of sunrise lighting the surrounding Chatsworth hills. Despite myself, I started to smile.
An awful lot of memories for a relationship that hadn’t lasted a year. Hadn’t lasted three months, to be accurate. In fact, calling it a “relationship” was kind of an exaggeration.
The only thing they ever had in common was the job. And a mutually weird sense of humor. And a love of Nissan cars and pizza. And the sex.
The only thing they ever had in common was the job. And a mutually weird sense of humor. And a love of Nissan cars and pizza. And the sex.

vocabularies.definition: 〔車が〕エンジンの音を立てる
vocabularies.example: “Okay. Thanks for staying on the line. You’ll be pleased to know I feel like an idiot.” “Try the engine.” “Now you’re just making fun of me.” “Well yeah, but try the engine anyway.” The engine purred into smooth life. “All systems go.” “Roger, Houston. Have a nice flight.

vocabularies.definition: 〔雨にぬれた路面などが〕ギラギラ光る
vocabularies.example: Surrounded by glistening pine trees, enveloped by rain and fog, for the first time it occurred to Elliot that his extended period of solitude just might be turning into loneliness.

He turned his head and Tucker’s big hand landed ungracefully on his shoulder, drawing him back as his warm mouth landed on Elliot’s. For an astonished moment Elliot was aware of nothing but the feel of Tucker’s hard, insistent lips on his, the almost desperate pressure, the taste, the scent, the disturbing reality of Tucker’s desire.

vocabularies.definition: 強く押す、突き刺すこと
vocabularies.example: “Tucker…” Tucker’s thrusts punctuated his words. “I missed you so…fucking…much…”
“Tucker…” Tucker’s thrusts punctuated his words. “I missed you so…fucking…much…”

“You’re crazy about me, Elliot. Why not admit it?” Elliot shook his head. “You’re nuts.” “Nah. You can’t kid a kidder.” He wrapped a muscular arm around Elliot and tugged him over. Elliot went with it, but he was still shaking his head over the sad state of Tucker’s sanity.
...his face bone white beneath the freckles and blue eyes wet and glittering with ferocious emotion. “If you even try to die, I’ll kill you myself,” Tucker had said in a choky voice.
It was a beautiful summer day. Not a cloud in the sky. And if the air had not been crackling with voices and radios and assorted engines, it would probably have felt tranquil, peaceful.
